intro: Pleurostylia heynei var. acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved pleurostylia, is a tropical plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often fragrant. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
